intro: Conioselinum gmelinii var. kamtschaticum, commonly known as Kamtschatic mountain caraway, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Europe and western Siberia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery scent, while the small white flowers appear in summer. This variety is noted for its resilience to cold climates and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
